name: Pink Primrose
description: Its large, four-petaled flowers, solitary from leaf axils, range in color from dark pink to white. Nodding buds, opening into pink or white flowers, are in the upper leaf axils on slender, downy stems. The delicate-textured, cup-shaped blossoms are lined with pink or red veins.

name: Hard-leaved Pocket Orchid
description: Paphiopedilum micranthum, described in 1951, is commonly known as the silver slipper orchid or hard-leaved pocket orchid. It blooms during late winter to early summer with one flower per inflorescence.

name: Canterbury Bells
description: Canterbury Bells is a tall biennial with showy flowers in an interesting cup-and-saucer shape that appears in the summer.

name: Sweet Pea
description: Lathyrus is a genus of annual or perennial, herbaceous vines with winged stems and showy flowers in the pea family.

name: English Marigold
description: This annual marigold has dark orange daisy-like flowers with reddish-brown tinted petals.

name: Tiger Lily
description: Tiger lilies boast bright orange blooms covered in black or crimson spots resembling a tiger's skin. These large, unscented flowers are 5 inches (12 cm) and mostly downward-facing, adorned with gracefully recurved tepals and held on long, upright stems.

name: Moon Orchid
description: Moon Orchids have nice creamy yellow bell-shaped flowers with rose pink on the outside and yellow on the inside. There is also a light fragrance. The foliage is very dark green, and covers the plants to the ground.

name: Bird of Paradise
description: Bird of paradise (Strelitzia reginae) is a dramatic plant with distinctive iridescent orange and midnight blue flowers that resemble an exotic bird peeking out from the broad leaves in autumn, winter and spring.

name: Monkshood
description: Monkshood also known as wolfsbane, is a poisonous perennial herb characterized by its distinctive, helmet-shaped flowers, often deep purple or blue, and deeply lobed leaves.

name: Globe Thistle
description: The Globe Thistle is a striking, 48"-tall, back-of-the-border plant with bold, spiky, 2" globes that open steel-blue and mature to bright blue.

name: Snapdragon
description: Snapdragons are popular garden plants known for their vibrant, colorful flowers and distinctive "snapping" blooms that resemble a dragon's mouth, with lance-shaped leaves and upright growth.

name: Colt's Foot
description: Colt's foot is a perennial herb with bright yellow, dandelion-like flowers that appear before the leaves in early spring, followed by large, heart-shaped leaves with a whitish underside.

name: King Protea
description: The King Protea, South Africa's national flower, is a large, striking evergreen shrub with bowl-shaped flower heads, 6-12 inches across, featuring a central bouquet of inner flowers surrounded by stiff, colorful bracts, ranging from creamy white to deep crimson.

name: Spear Thistle
description: The spear thistle is a prickly, biennial plant that produces purple, globe-shaped flowers surrounded by spiny bracts, often found in disturbed areas and grasslands.

name: Yellow Iris
description: Yellow Iris is a tall perennial that grows in wetlands, bearing large, showy yellow flowers with a distinct frilled appearance.

name: Globe-flower
description: Globe-flower is a perennial plant with globe-shaped yellow or orange flowers and deeply divided leaves, often found in moist meadows and wetlands.

name: Purple Coneflower
description: Purple coneflowers have large daisy-like flowers with striking purple petals and a prominent central cone. They are commonly used in landscaping and herbal remedies.

name: Peruvian Lily
description: Peruvian lilies are striking, colorful flowers that appear in shades of pink, orange, red, and purple, often with unique striped patterns.

name: Balloon Flower
description: Balloon flowers get their name from their buds, which resemble balloons before they open into star-shaped blue, pink, or white flowers.

name: Giant White Arum Lily
description: The Giant White Arum Lily features large white, trumpet-shaped flowers with a yellow spadix in the center. It's native to southern Africa and is grown as an ornamental plant.

name: Fire Lily
description: Fire lilies are vibrant, red flowers with striking, star-shaped blooms and long, sturdy stems.

name: Pincushion Flower
description: Pincushion flowers have unique, round, button-like blooms surrounded by slender, thread-like petals. They come in various colors, including pink, purple, and white.

name: Fritillary
description: Fritillarias have bell-shaped, often spotted flowers that hang downwards on tall stems. They come in colors such as red, yellow, and purple.

name: Red Ginger
description: Red Ginger is an ornamental plant with bright red, cone-shaped flowers surrounded by green bracts, native to the Pacific islands.

name: Grape Hyacinth
description: Grape hyacinths are small, fragrant flowers that grow in dense clusters and resemble a bunch of grapes, typically in shades of blue or purple.

name: Corn Poppy
description: Corn poppies are annual flowers with vibrant red petals, often found in fields and grasslands. They are known for their delicate, papery blooms.

name: Prince of Wales Feathers
description: The Prince of Wales feathers is a delicate, perennial flower with long, slender, white blooms that resemble a feather.

name: Stemless Gentian
description: Stemless Gentian is a low-growing perennial known for its vibrant blue, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom close to the ground in alpine meadows.

name: Artichoke
description: Artichokes are large, thistle-like flowers that are cultivated for their edible buds, which are harvested before the flowers bloom.

name: Sweet William
description: Sweet William is a biennial or short-lived perennial with fragrant, clustered flowers in colors like pink, red, and white.

name: Carnation
description: Carnations are popular flowers with frilled, ruffled petals in a variety of colors, commonly used in floral arrangements.

name: Garden Phlox
description: Garden phlox is a perennial plant that produces large clusters of brightly colored flowers, typically pink, red, or white.

name: Love in the Mist
description: Love in the Mist is a charming annual with delicate, feathery foliage and vibrant blue, pink, or white flowers with a unique star-shaped appearance.

name: Mexican Aster
description: Mexican Aster is a tall annual plant with daisy-like flowers in colors such as pink, white, and purple, often found in wildflower meadows.

name: Alpine Sea Holly
description: Alpine Sea Holly is a striking plant with spiny, blue-green leaves and blue, globe-shaped flowers that grow in rocky, mountainous regions.

name: Ruby-lipped Cattleya
description: Ruby-lipped Cattleyas are orchids known for their large, vibrant flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, with a distinctive red lip.

name: Cape Flower
description: The Cape Flower is native to South Africa and produces striking, tubular flowers with a unique color range, from pink to purple, often found in mountainous areas.

name: Great Masterwort
description: Great Masterwort is a perennial plant with star-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink, red, and white, surrounded by papery bracts.

name: Siam Tulip
description: Siam tulips are flowering plants with pink or purple bracts that resemble tulips, often grown as ornamental flowers in Southeast Asia.

name: Lenten Rose
description: Lenten Roses are early bloomers that produce nodding, cup-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, purple, and green, often seen in late winter to early spring.

name: Barbeton Daisy
description: The Barbeton Daisy is a bright and vibrant flower with large daisy-like blooms in colors like red, yellow, orange, and pink.

name: Daffodil
description: Daffodils are trumpet-shaped flowers with bright yellow petals and a central corona, often blooming in early spring.

name: Sword Lily
description: Sword lilies are tall plants with spike-like stems covered in trumpet-shaped flowers, often in shades of red, pink, or white.

name: Poinsettia
description: Poinsettias are known for their vibrant red and green foliage and are widely associated with the Christmas season.

name: Bolero Deep Blue
description: Bolero Deep Blue is a hybrid petunia variety with deep blue, velvety flowers, often used in hanging baskets and containers.

name: Wallflower
description: Wallflowers are hardy perennials with four-petaled flowers that come in a range of colors, including yellow, orange, and purple.

name: Marigold
description: Marigolds are bright, cheerful annuals with ruffled, yellow to orange flowers, often used to repel pests in gardens.

name: Buttercup
description: Buttercups are bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring and are common in fields and meadows.

name: Oxeye Daisy
description: Oxeye Daisies are white, daisy-like flowers with a central yellow disk, commonly found in wildflower meadows and roadside areas.

name: Common Dandelion
description: The common dandelion is a widely recognized weed with bright yellow flowers that turn into fluffy seed heads.

name: Petunia
description: Petunias are colorful, fragrant flowers that come in shades of pink, purple, white, and red, often used in hanging baskets and garden beds.

name: Wild Pansy
description: Wild pansies are small, colorful flowers with purple, yellow, and white petals, often found in wildflower meadows.

name: Primula
description: Primulas are perennial plants with vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, pink, purple, and white.

name: Sunflower
description: Sunflowers are large, bright yellow flowers that face the sun, with a central disk surrounded by long, yellow petals.

name: Pelargonium
description: Pelargoniums, also known as geraniums, are popular flowering plants with vibrant red, pink, or white blooms.

name: Bishop of Llandaff
description: The Bishop of Llandaff is a cultivar of dahlia with dark, almost black foliage and bright red flowers.

name: Gaura
description: Gaura is a perennial plant with delicate white or pink flowers that dance on long, slender stems.

name: Geranium
description: Geraniums are popular garden flowers with rounded leaves and vibrant blooms in a variety of colors.

name: Orange Dahlia
description: Orange dahlias are large, brightly colored flowers with layered petals that bloom from mid-summer until fall.

name: Pink-yellow Dahlia
description: A variety of dahlia, pink-yellow dahlias feature a beautiful gradient of pink petals and yellow at the center.

name: Cautleya Spicata
description: Cautleya spicata is a rare herbaceous plant with bright orange to red spiked flowers and large, ornamental foliage.

name: Japanese Anemone
description: Japanese anemones are perennial flowers that bloom in late summer to fall, with white or pink, cup-shaped flowers.

name: Black-eyed Susan
description: Black-eyed Susan is a wildflower with bright yellow petals and a dark central disk, often found in meadows and roadsides.

name: Silverbush
description: Silverbush is a shrubby plant with silvery foliage and small, funnel-shaped white or pink flowers.

name: Californian Poppy
description: Californian poppies are vibrant orange, cup-shaped flowers that grow in dry, rocky areas and fields across California.

name: Osteospermum
description: Osteospermums are daisy-like flowers with wide, colorful petals that bloom from spring through fall.

name: Spring Crocus
description: Spring crocus is one of the first flowers to bloom in the spring, with delicate purple, white, or yellow flowers.

name: Bearded Iris
description: Bearded irises have showy flowers with wide petals that have fuzzy beards running along the center. They come in various colors, including blue, purple, and white.

name: Windflower
description: Windflowers are delicate blooms that come in a variety of colors, including blue, white, and purple.

name: Tree Poppy
description: Tree poppies are large, shrubby plants with huge white or cream-colored flowers that have a yellow center.

name: Gazania
description: Gazania flowers have bright, daisy-like blooms in colors such as yellow, orange, and red, and are known for their ability to bloom even in full sunlight.

name: Azalea
description: Azaleas are flowering shrubs that produce beautiful, colorful blooms, ranging from pink to red to purple.

name: Water Lily
description: Water lilies are aquatic plants with large, round leaves and beautiful flowers in shades of white, pink, yellow, and blue.

name: Rose
description: Roses are well-known for their fragrant, multi-petaled flowers that come in various colors, commonly red, pink, and white.

name: Thorn Apple
description: Thorn apple, also known as Jimson weed, is a toxic plant that features trumpet-shaped flowers, often white or purple, and spiky seed pods.

name: Morning Glory
description: Morning glories are climbing vines with funnel-shaped flowers that bloom early in the morning, often in shades of purple, blue, or pink.

name: Passion Flower
description: Passion flowers are exotic blooms with intricate, multi-colored petals and tendrils, often used for ornamental purposes.

name: Lotus
description: Lotus flowers are large, fragrant aquatic blooms that appear in shades of pink or white, often floating atop the water's surface.

name: Toad Lily
description: Toad lilies are exotic plants with spotted, delicate flowers in shades of purple or white.

name: Anthurium
description: Anthurium, also known as the flamingo flower, is an ornamental plant with glossy, heart-shaped bracts and a long central spadix.

name: Frangipani
description: Frangipanis are tropical flowers with large, fragrant blooms in shades of white, pink, and yellow.

name: Clematis
description: Clematis is a climbing vine with large, showy flowers that come in many colors, including purple, red, and white.

name: Hibiscus
description: Hibiscus flowers are large, trumpet-shaped blooms with vibrant colors such as red, pink, and yellow.

name: Columbine
description: Columbine flowers have unique, spurred petals and come in shades of blue, red, yellow, and purple.

name: Desert-Rose
description: Desert-rose plants have striking flowers in shades of pink or red, native to arid regions.

name: Tree Mallow
description: Tree mallow produces large, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple and is typically grown as an ornamental shrub.

name: Magnolia
description: Magnolia trees are known for their large, fragrant flowers, which range in color from white to pink to purple.

name: Cyclamen
description: Cyclamen flowers are often pink or white with heart-shaped leaves, and they bloom during the colder months.

name: Watercress
description: Watercress is a small, peppery herb that grows in water and is often used in salads.

name: Canna Lily
description: Canna lilies are tropical plants with large, dramatic flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange.

name: Hippeastrum
description: Hippeastrum, or amaryllis, is known for its large, trumpet-shaped flowers in colors like red, pink, and white.

name: Bee Balm
description: Bee balm is a perennial with spiky flowers in colors like red, pink, or purple, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.

name: Ball Moss
description: Ball moss is a species of bromeliad that grows as an epiphyte, often seen hanging from trees and producing small, greenish flowers.

name: Foxglove
description: Foxgloves are tall plants with bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple, white, or yellow, often used for their medicinal properties.

name: Bougainvillea
description: Bougainvillea is a climbing vine known for its colorful bracts, which come in shades of purple, red, and pink.

name: Camellia
description: Camellias are evergreen shrubs with large, fragrant flowers in colors such as pink, red, and white.

name: Mallow
description: Mallow flowers are often pink or purple and have a characteristic round shape, often found growing wild in fields.

name: Mexican Petunia
description: Mexican petunias are hardy perennials with trumpet-shaped, purple or pink flowers and long, slender stems.

name: Bromelia
description: Bromelia is a tropical flowering plant with long, spiky foliage and colorful, exotic flowers, often found in Central and South America.

name: Blanket Flower
description: Blanket flowers have brightly colored petals, often in shades of red and yellow, and are a popular addition to wildflower gardens.

name: Trumpet Creeper
description: Trumpet creepers are vigorous climbing vines with large, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of orange or red, attracting hummingbirds.

name: Blackberry Lily
description: Blackberry lilies are perennial plants with orange, spotted flowers and a fruit resembling a blackberry.
